name: Tough Christmas Music Quiz | Music Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: "It is wrong when the babe is sleeping, it is wrong to talk so loud."
options: Lo, How a Rose E'er Blooming
questions.explanation:
Bring a Torch Jeannette, Isabella.

	A beautiful French carol.

questions.text: "Evergreen are its branches clean. It is king of all the woodland scene."
options: A Favor For the Little Christmas Tree
questions.explanation:
Gather Around the Christmas Tree.

	A powerful English carol with a raucous chorus of "Hosannah in the Highest."

questions.text: "Why should men on Earth be so sad when our redeemer made us glad?"
questions.explanation:
On Christmas Night.

	The other three are (obviously) carols from England with very distinctive melodies.

questions.text: "Streams of streetlights, even stoplights, blink a bright red and green."
options: It's Beginning To Look A Lot Like Christmas
The Most Wonderful Time of the Year
questions.explanation:
Silver Bells.

	This was written as a portrait of the city at Christmas time. The bells referred to in the title were the Salvation Army bells. It was originally written as "Tinkle Bells", but the wife of the man who wrote it reminded him what "tinkle" meant to most people, so it was quickly changed.

questions.text: "I just got back from a lovely trip along the Milky Way."
questions.correct: Santa Claus is Coming To Town
questions.explanation:
Santa Claus is Coming To Town.

	The often forgotten introduction to this song. (I made up the Rudolph one.)

questions.text: "Good Christian Men Rejoice" has its lyrics set to what Christmas piece written by Bach?
options: A Mighty Fortress Is Our God
questions.explanation:
In Dulci Jubilo.

	Bach wrote all of these pieces. Incidently, "A Mighty Fortress" is the theme to the children's show "Davy and Goliath."

questions.text: What is the original French name of the carol commonly known as "O Holy Night"?
questions.explanation:
Cantique de Noel.

	There really is a French carol which translates as "What is That Beautiful Smell."

Mel Torme.

	I'd love to get his royalty check every season!

questions.text: Which famous silly Christmas song was made famous by Spike Jones?
questions.correct: All I Want For Christmas Is My Two Front Teeth
options: I Saw Mommy Kissing Santa Claus
I Want A Hippopotamus for Christmas
questions.explanation: All I Want For Christmas Is My Two Front Teeth.

questions.text: Handel's Messiah has come to be known as a Christmas oratorio. Which is not a selection from that work?
questions.correct: Blessed Are the Meek, For They Shall Inherit
options: Why Do the Nations So Furiously Rage Together
And He Shall Purify the Sons of Levi
questions.explanation:
Blessed Are the Meek, For They Shall Inherit.

	No actual words of Jesus are used in the Messiah.
